channel.title: "Error connecting to server"
channel.description:
Hi everyone. I'm new to rsps's, so sorry for the stupid question. I'm using the Aggroth V2 source (found here: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,653626.0.html), and when I run the server I get this: [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/I8KESAz.png[/img] However, when I run the client with the server still open, it says error connecting to server. Any idea what I'm doing wrong, or is the source just broke? Any help is appreciated
I have updated Java and JDK to the most recent versions and I am running Windows 7 on a 64-bit laptop if that helps.

item.title: "Error connecting to server"
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“KKZ, post:19, topic:545141”]afaik internal IP address is your local network address, meaning us knowing it will literally do nothing for us, because it’s not your external (or “broadcast”) IP. it’s not this one: http://whatismyip.com which is one you can keep secret so people don’t DDoS you or w/e.

use a realistic port checker like http://www.pcwintech.com/simple-port-tester (he also has a automatic port forwarder with this tool built in http://www.simpleportforwarding.com/ )[/quote]
Thanks, I’ll try that. But I thought you only needed to portforward if you wanted other people to access your server? If i just wanted to go on by myself, would I still need to port forward?
[/quote]
No not at all. If you want to play by yourself, you don’t need the port opened. You’re totally right on that.

I’d suggest you look into the client for issues connecting to the server.

Read full topic

item.title: "Error connecting to server"
item.dc:creator: @KKZ KKZ
item.description:
@KKZ wrote:

afaik internal IP address is your local network address, meaning us knowing it will literally do nothing for us, because it’s not your external (or “broadcast”) IP. it’s not this one: http://whatismyip.com which is one you can keep secret so people don’t DDoS you or w/e.

use a realistic port checker like http://www.pcwintech.com/simple-port-tester (he also has a automatic port forwarder with this tool built in http://www.simpleportforwarding.com/ )
[/quote]
Thanks, I’ll try that. But I thought you only needed to portforward if you wanted other people to access your server? If i just wanted to go on by myself, would I still need to port forward?

Read full topic

item.title: "Error connecting to server"
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“KKZ, post:17, topic:545141”][quote author=runescape sucks link=topic=664023.msg4438706#msg4438706 date=1405867512]
What are you trying to connect to with your client? Your external IP?

If so, you need to be portforwarded on port 43594(or the port your server uses, but it’s probably 43594)
[/quote]
This is the the portforward that I did on my router.

Not sure if I did it right[/quote]
afaik internal IP address is your local network address, meaning us knowing it will literally do nothing for us, because it’s not your external (or “broadcast”) IP. it’s not this one: http://whatismyip.com which is one you can keep secret so people don’t DDoS you or w/e.

use a realistic port checker like http://www.pcwintech.com/simple-port-tester (he also has a automatic port forwarder with this tool built in http://www.simpleportforwarding.com/ )

Read full topic

item.title: "Error connecting to server"
item.dc:creator: @KKZ KKZ
item.description:
@KKZ wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:14, topic:545141”]Why are you guys even wasting your time on this?
That code you’re soooo worried about changing looks like this:

System.out.println(String) sends a message to the console. Nothing more. It has no effect on running your server.[/quote]
Like I said, I’m new when it comes to running an RSPS, so I had no idea what it meant. All I’m trying to do is get my server online.

Read full topic

item.title: "Error connecting to server"
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

That’s normal. Most compilers say that(and I suggest learning how to use an IDE, it’ll be much better in the long run)

Then try using 127.0.0.1 or no ip at all. If it says server = “your-ip” replace it with server = “”;

Read full topic

item.title: "Error connecting to server"
item.dc:creator: @Camballer Camballer
item.description:
@Camballer wrote:

They’re right but if you’re having trouble try searching 77.171.122.218 and changing all instances to 127.0.0.1 , this would only work if you’re using the client that corresponds with the source.

Read full topic

item.title: "Error connecting to server"
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

KKZ:

So how do I fix the problem, then?

[quote=“arkanis93, post:4, topic:545141”]Go into the Client files, open Client.java, search for Server = , and a number should appear after that, change that to 127.0.0.1.

Save it and compile. It should work.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: "Error connecting to server"
item.dc:creator: @arkanis93 arkanis93
item.description:
@arkanis93 wrote:

Go into the Client files, open Client.java, search for Server = , and a number should appear after that, change that to 127.0.0.1.

Save it and compile. It should work.

Read full topic
